Material used.Description: M17 human neuroblastoma cells and rat PC12 cells were used for transfection and protein expression analysis.

Readout description.Result Description: L166P DJ-1 was barely detectable, indicating high instability and drastic reduction in protein levels compared to wild-type.
M26I showed reduced steady-state protein levels (30-50% of wild-type), indicating moderate instability.
E64D was reported to be stable, with protein levels comparable to wild-type.
R98Q was fully stable, expressed at similar levels to wild-type protein.
A104T was expressed at similar levels to wild-type protein, indicating stability.
D149A was expressed at similar levels to wild-type protein, indicating stability.

Biological replicates.Description: Results are representative of at least triplicate transfections for each construct.

Technical replicates.Description: No specific mention of technical replicates in the literature.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 protein was used as a positive control for comparison of stability and expression levels.

Basic negative control.Description: Untransfected, mock-transfected, or GFP-transfected cells were used as negative controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One-way ANOVA with Student-Newman-Keuls post hoc tests.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein levels comparable to wild-type DJ-1 (approximately 90-100% of wild-type levels).

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Protein levels significantly reduced compared to wild-type (less than 60% of wild-type levels).

Material used.Description: M17 cells were co-transfected with V5-tagged variants and myc-tagged wild-type DJ-1 for dimerization studies.

Readout description.Result Description: L166P did not form dimers, existing only as monomers, suggesting disruption of dimerization.
M26I retained the ability to dimerize, though at potentially reduced efficiency.
E64D was not specifically tested for dimerization but assumed stable based on other assays.
R98Q effectively co-immunoprecipitated with wild-type protein, indicating normal dimerization.
A104T effectively co-immunoprecipitated with wild-type protein, indicating normal dimerization.
D149A effectively co-immunoprecipitated with wild-type protein, indicating normal dimerization.

Biological replicates.Description: Data are representative of at least duplicate experiments for each construct.

Technical replicates.Description: No specific mention of technical replicates in the literature.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 protein was used as a positive control for dimerization studies.

Basic negative control.Description: Vector-only transfected cells were used as a negative control.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Presence of dimer bands in immunoprecipitation or cross-linking assays comparable to wild-type.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Absence or significant reduction of dimer bands in immunoprecipitation or cross-linking assays compared to wild-type.

Material used.Description: M17 cells were transfected with V5-tagged DJ-1 variants for localization studies.

Readout description.Result Description: L166P showed similar localization to wild-type, with increased mitochondrial localization under oxidative stress.
M26I showed similar localization to wild-type, with increased mitochondrial localization under oxidative stress.
E64D showed similar localization patterns to wild-type (assumed based on general findings for variants).
R98Q showed similar localization patterns to wild-type (assumed based on general findings for variants).
A104T showed similar localization patterns to wild-type (assumed based on general findings for variants).
D149A showed similar localization patterns to wild-type (assumed based on general findings for variants).

Biological replicates.Description: Each experiment is representative of duplicate transfections performed at least twice for each construct.

Technical replicates.Description: No specific mention of technical replicates in the literature.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 protein was used as a positive control for localization studies.

Basic negative control.Description: No specific negative control mentioned for localization studies.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Localization pattern similar to wild-type DJ-1, predominantly cytoplasmic with some mitochondrial staining under oxidative stress.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant deviation from wild-type localization pattern, such as exclusive mitochondrial or cytoplasmic localization.
